patch.description:
Updates a Application object.

In case Application object is paused then allowed attributes for update action are: 

 `availability_status, availability_status_error, last_checked_at, last_available_at`

207.description: Multi-status, some parameters are unpermitted due to paused resource(or related) but some parameters are valid.

422.description: Unprocessable Entity due to paused resource or paused related resource

QueryLimit.name: limit
QueryLimit.description: The numbers of items to return per page.

QueryOffset.name: offset
QueryOffset.description: The number of items to skip before starting to collect the result set.

QuerySortBy.name: sort_by
QuerySortBy.description: The list of attribute and order to sort the result set by.

BadRequest.description: There is a problem either with the parameters or the payload

NotFound.description: The requested resource was not found

Unauthorized.description: Either the "x-rh-identity" or the "x-rh-sources-psk" headers are missing, or you don't have enough permission to query the endpoint

availability_status.description: The availability status of the endpoint.

default.description: Mark endpoint as the default endpoint? Each source can only have one default endpoint. It gets set to true by default if the given source has no endpoints.

host.description: URI host component of the endpoint.

path.description: URI path component of the endpoint.

port.description: URI port component of the endpoint.

role.description: The role of the endpoint. It must be unique among the source's endpoints.

source_id.description: The id of the source this endpoint relates to.

verify_ssl.description: Should the SSL certificate be verified?

ErrorBadRequest.description: Error structure for the "Bad Request" responses

detail.example: The provided path parameters are invalid

ErrorNotFound.description: Error structure for the "Not Found" responses

operationName.description: If the Query contains several named operations, the operationName controls which one should be executed

errors.description: Errors resulting from the GraphQL query

RhcConnectionCollection.description: Collection of Red Hat Connector Connections along with the metadata

availability_status.description: The availability status of the connection

last_checked_at.description: Timestamp of the last time the availability was checked for the connection

last_available_at.description: Timestamp of the last time the connection was available

availability_status_error.description: The received error message when polling for the availability status

uid.title: Unique ID of the inventory source installation

sources.description:
Array of Source objects to create. Only supported fields are name + type, source_type_id will automatically
be set based on the `source_type_name`.

endpoints.description:
Array of Endpoint objects to create. The operation looks up the parent source by the `source_name` attribute
so the `source_name` must match one of the `source`'s names in the payload.

applications.description:
Array of Application objects to create. The operation looks up the parent Source by the `source_name` attribute
so the `source_name` must match one of the `source`'s names in the payload.

application_type_id will be automatically looked up and set by the `application_type_name` attribute via regex.

authentications.description:
Array of Authentications to create. This one is a bit more tricky. `resource_type` tells the action where to look for the parent, must be either application/endpoint/source

if the parent is a source, it looks up by name.
if the parent is an endpoint, it looks up via host so the hostname must match.
if the parent is an application, it looks up via application type so the value must match the application type which matches

detail.example: Listed parameters in 'resource' has been updated successfully.
